original_title: Review | Claire Danes and Matthew Rhys are deadly frenemies in ‘The Beast in Me’ - The Washington Post
summary: The real treat is the off-kilter affinity that develops between a nervy writer and the disgraced real-estate mogul next door. Claire Danes and Matthew Rhys are deadly frenemies in ‘The Beast in Me’ The Washington Post. author: Lili Loofbourow. date: 2025-11-13.

original_title: 'The Devil Wears Prada 2' just dropped its 1st teaser trailer showing Anne Hathaway and Meryl Streep together again after 20 years - Yahoo
summary: The first official teaser for "The Devil Wears Prada 2" reunites fans with Anne Hathaway, Meryl Streep, and the sleek offices of Runway Magazine. The film is set to be released on November 13, 2015. It stars Hathaway and Meryl Streep.

original_title: Ammonia leak in Oklahoma leaves dozens hospitalized, forces hundreds to evacuate - CBS News
summary: Ammonia leak in Oklahoma leaves dozens hospitalized, forces hundreds to evacuate. A chemical spill left dozens hospitalized and forcedHundreds to evacuate from a western Oklahoma city. The chemical spill was caused by a leak of ammonia in the city's wastewater treatment system. The city is in western Oklahoma, near the Oklahoma-Oklahoma border.

summary: S&P 500 Futures Inc Lower After Shutdown Ends; Disney Falls. Live Updates - The Wall Street Journal. date: 2025-11-13T13:14:00Z. title: Stock Market Today: S-P 500 futures Inc Lower after Shutdown ends; Disney falls.

original_title: Disney raises dividend and buybacks as theme parks defy downturn fears - Financial Times
summary: Disney raises dividend and buybacks as theme parks defy downturn fears. Growth in experiences business offsets absence of blockbuster movies and continued television revenue decline. Disney to buy back $2.5 billion in stock this year, up from $1.9 billion last year. Share price expected to rise as a result.

original_title: DJI’s Neo 2 selfie drone launches globally, but not in the US - The Verge
summary: DJI's Neo 2 selfie drone launches globally, but not in the US. New obstacle avoidance features, gesture controls, and a longer flight time, but no US availability. The drone has a price tag of $1,000. It will be available in the U.S. in the coming weeks.

original_title: What new Epstein emails say. And, ACA subsidies in limbo - NPR
summary: Details on the newly released emails from Jeffrey Epstein. Health insurance subsidies remain in limbo, with a vote on the matter expected next month. And, the government shutdown has ended, but health insurance subsidies are still in limbo. For more, go to CNN.com/soulmatestories.

original_title: 6 Patriots to watch against the Jets on Thursday Night Football - Pats Pulpit
summary: The Patriots will host their AFC East rivals at Gillette Stadium on Thursday Night Football. The game will be broadcast live on the NFL Network at 8 p.m. ET. The Patriots have won the last three games against the Jets. The Jets have won just one of their last seven games against New England.

original_title: How Lady Gaga Found Herself Again: ‘I Feel Lucky to Be Alive’ - Rolling Stone
summary: 'I Feel Lucky to Be Alive' is one of Lady Gaga's best-selling albums. 'Mayhem' is considered to be one of the best albums of all time. 'I feel lucky to be alive' is Gaga's first single since 'Born This Way' in 2009.

original_title: Iraq Election Results Set Stage for a Long Power Struggle - The Wall Street Journal
summary: The Wall Street Journal: Iraq Election Results Set Stage for a Long Power Struggle. The Journal: The election results set the stage for a long power struggle in Iraq. The article was originally published on November 13, 2015. It has been updated to reflect the latest developments in the Iraq election.

original_title: Lawyers for Comey, Letitia James to argue in court that their cases should be dismissed - CBS News
summary: Lawyers for Comey, Letitia James to argue in court that their cases should be dismissed. Comey and James are arguing their indictments should be. dismissed because the appointment of the interim U.S. attorney in Virginia was unlawful. The case is expected to be heard in federal court in Washington, D.C.

original_title: The Trump administration is ‘actively evaluating’ portable mortgages. What you need to know - CNN
summary: The Trump administration is ‘actively evaluating’ portable mortgages. The idea is to let homeowners take their mortgage rate with them when they move. The move would help make housing more affordable for the middle class. The proposal is being considered by the White House's Housing and Urban Development Department.

original_title: Steam Machine: Valve rivals Xbox and PlayStation with new console - BBC
summary: The Steam Machine is a console designed to allow gamers to play PC games on their TV. It is designed to compete with the Xbox One and PlayStation 4. The console is expected to go on sale in the second half of next year. The price has not yet been announced.

original_title: Starbucks workers kick off 65-store US strike on company’s busy Red Cup Day - AP News
summary: More than 1,000 unionized Starbucks workers are on strike Thursday at 65 U.S. stores. The strike has closed some stores on Starbucks’ Red Cup Day, which is typically one of the company’s busiest days of the year. Starbucks gives away free, reusable cups on the day.

original_title: Israel deported Palestinian prisoners to Egypt. Some Israelis question the practice - NPR
summary: Israel deported more than 150 freed Palestinian prisoners last month. Some Israelis question the practice. Some experts in Israel warn it could have long-term consequences for Israeli security. The U.S. State Department says it has no immediate comment on the deportation of Palestinian prisoners to Egypt.

original_title: Lupus may be caused by the common Epstein-Barr virus, study finds - NBC News
summary: Lupus is an autoimmune disease with wide-ranging symptoms. Epstein-Barr virus could be the cause of lupus, according to a study. The virus is one of the most common in the world, and is thought to be responsible for around one in every 10,000 cases of the disease.

original_title: Samsung’s trifold gets a name and ‘confirmed’ specs - The Verge
summary: The Galaxy Z TriFold could launch on December 5th. It is expected to cost around $300. Samsung has not yet confirmed the release date or price of the tri-fold phone. It will be available in black and white, with a black screen and a white screen.

original_title: Jason Mackey: Cy Young winner Paul Skenes used his words. The Pirates darn well better listen - Pittsburgh Post-Gazette
summary: Pittsburgh Post-Gazette: Cy Young winner Paul Skenes used his words. The Pirates darn well better listen, Jason Mackey says. The team's next game is against the New York Mets on Friday night. The game is scheduled to start at 7 p.m. ET.

original_title: Tuberculosis kills 1.23 million people last year, WHO says - Al Jazeera
summary: UN health agency warns recent progress in tackling the disease is under threat due to a shortfall in critical aid. Tuberculosis kills 1.23 million people last year, WHO says. The disease is one of the world's leading killers of people aged between 15 and 64.
